title: arabspaceship123
author: arabspaceship123
content: I found these imitation trader scammers stealing Bitcoin. They won't pay you using Mastercard Paypal Skrill. It's a deceitful website stealing money.ok247trade.comDon't use them !

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: Typical fake exchange. Obscure, dreadful grammatical errors, usual money laundering accusations and ridiculous mandatory tax payment fee AKA deposit before you can withdraw scam.Gotta say, their domain name is quite funny lmao as I find "ok247trade" on the same level with "No scam" or "100% legit/real" - words some scammers use a lot.

comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: Quote from: arabspaceship123 on April 22, 2023, 05:05:08 AMI found these imitation trader scammers stealing Bitcoin. They won't pay you using Mastercard Paypal Skrill. It's a deceitful website stealing money.Never heard about that site, but from its name it sounds like a scam site. Everything has been done on that site in a unprofessional way. I would recommend you to stay away from such scams, and always give priority to exchanges with positive reputation. Such scam sites are made to take advantage of those people who aren't not good at technology. Their main targets are those innocent people who would trust scam like this due to their low awareness levels. How did you found that site, were they promoting their sites via advertisement or social media or you found it on search engines?

comments.author: SFR10
comments.body: Quote from: arabspaceship123 on April 22, 2023, 05:05:08 AMok247trade.comDon't use them !~Snipped~It appears to be a rip-off of "ICMarkets [note: I prefer not to vouch]" and instead of taking multiple screenshots of various places on their website, you could've just used a web-capturing website: Archived version of Ok247TradeHere are a few other similar fake websites:- ActiveBitSignal- MoodyFx- GLPrimeTradeFXs

comments.author: JeromeTash
comments.created_time: April 22, 2023, 09:56:31 PMLast edit: May 14, 2023, 03:38:01 PM by JeromeTash
comments.body: Another giveaway. Under "about Us"  they claim they are located in Germany.but on the footer of the website, the information indicates that their address is in the UK

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Where did you find this. What a good catch. Looks like another shitty people trying to make their luck scamming innocent newbies.Quote from: JeromeTash on April 22, 2023, 09:56:31 PMAnother giveaway. Under "about Us"  they claim they are located in Germany.but on the footer of the website, the information indicates that their address is in the UK  Yeah, whata shitty heads, rushed and grammatically wrong phrase is written all over the site.

comments.author: John Abraham
comments.body: Quote from: JeromeTash on April 22, 2023, 09:56:31 PMAnother giveaway. Under "about Us"  they claim they are located in Germany.but on the footer of the website, the information indicates that their address is in the UK  Their domain Lookup said they are from USA. 18 San Carlos Street, Los Angeles, California is their registration address. Of course, this is a fake address to register their domain. Since the business is to scam people, there is no reason they will register with their original information. But, At least they could use the same address in all three places. So it would look more trustworthy. Anyways, Thanks OP for bringing them here. I think I had never heard of them before. They registered the domain in October 2022. So, it's already six months old. I don't think they will come here. This is their domain info.QuoteImportant DatesExpires On2023-10-12Registered On2022-10-12Updated On2022-10-12Name Serversns1.dns-parking.com162.159.24.201ns2.dns-parking.com162.159.25.42Registrant Contact Information:NameWhoisSecureOrganizationWhoisSecureAddress18 San Carlos StreetCityLos AngelesState / ProvinceCaliforniaPostal Code94110CountryUnited StatesPhone+1.6144481974Email

comments.author: arabspaceship123
comments.created_time: April 30, 2023, 08:13:39 AMLast edit: April 30, 2023, 11:04:12 AM by arabspaceship123
comments.body: Quote from: Potato Chips on April 22, 2023, 08:37:56 AMTypical fake exchange. Obscure, dreadful grammatical errors, usual money laundering accusations and ridiculous mandatory tax payment fee AKA deposit before you can withdraw scam.In the course of time they'll steal some btc because they'll forever find people who'll send bitcoin to them.Quote from: SamReomo on April 22, 2023, 10:13:37 AMNever heard about that site, but from its name it sounds like a scam site. Everything has been done on that site in a unprofessional way. It's visibly a scam & it's unprofessional. It deserves to be reported here so people can be warned.Quote from: SFR10 on April 22, 2023, 11:27:36 AMIt appears to be a rip-off of "ICMarkets [note: I prefer not to vouch]" and instead of taking multiple screenshots of various places on their website, you could've just used a web-capturing website: Archived version of Ok247TradeHere are a few other similar fake websites:- ActiveBitSignal- MoodyFx- GLPrimeTradeFXsThanks! I'm willing to learn about how things work best when I post so I'll use web.archive.org & screenshots.

comments.author: stompix
comments.body: Quote from: John Abraham on April 23, 2023, 05:57:08 AMTheir domain Lookup said they are from USA. 18 San Carlos Street, Los Angeles, California is their registration address. Of course, this is a fake address to register their domain. Since the business is to scam people, there is no reason they will register with their original information.They use whoissecure, the address you see is the address and contact information of the service.Not necessarily a scam just from that, Binance s doing the same for example:https://whois.domaintools.com/binance.comBut the funny part with these guys is definitely this one:QuoteAnti Money Laundering Is Active Here. Do Not Upload Fake Payment Proof. Any Account That Register and do not make deposit within 96hrs will be banned and deleted from the system.Never in my life heard of a service that will ban you if in 4 days you don't deposit or you don't place an order or anything like that. I'm too lazy to try but is they have a counter on this time limit it would be beyond ridiculous!Quoteit is manadatory you pay your 10% trading commisson and one time Tax payment fee for new investor on Ok247Trade.Omg!

comments.author: arabspaceship123
comments.body: Quote from: stompix on April 30, 2023, 12:08:50 PMBut the funny part with these guys is definitely this one:QuoteAnti Money Laundering Is Active Here. Do Not Upload Fake Payment Proof. Any Account That Register and do not make deposit within 96hrs will be banned and deleted from the system.It's the first I've seen warnings from scammers. If they're trying to short the time between register & payment of proof it's a remarkable way to scam. Is 96hrs a generous threat?Quote from: stompix on April 30, 2023, 12:08:50 PMNever in my life heard of a service that will ban you if in 4 days you don't deposit or you don't place an order or anything like that. I'm too lazy to try but is they have a counter on this time limit it would be beyond ridiculous!Quoteit is manadatory you pay your 10% trading commisson and one time Tax payment fee for new investor on Ok247Trade.Omg!It's a scam with the wrong name it should've been called NotOk247Trade.com

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: Quote from: Potato Chips on April 22, 2023, 08:37:56 AMTypical fake exchange. Obscure, dreadful grammatical errors, usual money laundering accusations and ridiculous mandatory tax payment fee AKA deposit before you can withdraw scam.Gotta say, their domain name is quite funny lmao as I find "ok247trade" on the same level with "No scam" or "100% legit/real" - words some scammers use a lot.Scammers are good at picking the right domain name and creating enticing words to compel investors to invest, this platform is new they just launched 5 months ago, and their terms are questionable and dubious they make you sound like they are strict and legit, and now there's a scam complaint, this will stop their track of scamming people.Checking Google when I search for ok247trade.com this thread is in the third position, glad that it quickly gets indexed.

comments.author: arabspaceship123
comments.body: If they've launched 5 months ago they couldn't earn a substantial scam income. If they aren't stopped we'll find a profusion of scam allegations ahead.Quote from: coin-investor on May 01, 2023, 09:37:08 AMScammers are good at picking the right domain name and creating enticing words to compel investors to invest, this platform is new they just launched 5 months ago, and their terms are questionable and dubious they make you sound like they are strict and legit, and now there's a scam complaint, this will stop their track of scamming people.Checking Google when I search for ok247trade.com this thread is in the third position, glad that it quickly gets indexed.
